comments.body:
I have seen people do this:
```suggestion
    "_comment" : "This lists all files of a sample in the format [<Sample name>, <File name>, <Sample weight>, <Filter efficiency>, <integrated luminosity>]",
    "data" : [
```
I'm just guessing blindly what's really in the file, because there are no comments. :-D

It's in the code when the data is extracted from the json:

```python
        # Construct the dataframes
        folder = d[0] # Folder name
        sample = d[1] # Sample name
        xsecs[sample] = d[2] # Cross-section
        sumws[sample] = d[3] # Sum of weights
        num_events = d[4] # Number of events
```

I doubt that people will look in detail in the json, it's basically a database. And I'm iterating in the code over the keys ;)
Yes, I saw that you iterate the keys later - after I wondered what's in the cryptic json that github chose to show first. :-D
